channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Employee surveillance software sales surge in lockdown
item.description: Sales of employee monitoring software have skyrocketed since the country went into lockdown, with tech companies reporting a 300 percent increase for New Zealand customers.

item.title: Police treated protection request during lockdown as OIA
item.description: Police have been forced to apologise to a woman after mishandling an information request for an urgent protection order during the lockdown.

item.title: Cabinet to consider alert level 1 move on 8 June
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says Cabinet will consider moving to alert level 1 on 8 June.

item.title: Police identify man who didn't know himself
item.description: Police have identified a man who woke up from a coma in Wellington Hospital and didn't know who he was.

item.title: Rain brings down trees, pushes holidaymakers to extend stay
item.description: Wet and wild weather for the first holiday weekend out of lockdown flooded roads and caused slips in the Coromandel.

item.title: Tramper reported swept down Hawke's Bay river
item.description: Search and rescue teams are heading into the Ruahine Forest Park to search for a tramper who was swept down a river.

item.title: Photo essay: Thousands march in solidarity with Black Lives Matter
item.description: Thousands of New Zealanders have joined large numbers of Americans in protesting following the killing of Minneapolis man George Floyd.

item.title: It's the hardest word: Here's how to get 'sorry' right
item.description: It seems we've been getting it wrong when we say sorry. Evolutionary psychologists have spent years researching apologies and have some tips.

item.title: Bodies recovered after glider crash near Taupō
item.description: The bodies of two people killed in a glider crash near Taupō have been recovered.

item.title: Recap: Thousands march in Auckland, hundreds gather in Wellington for Black Lives Matter
item.description: Thousands of New Zealanders today in Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch and Dunedin took part in Black Lives Matter solidarity events.

item.title: Yacht swept to shore, longliner leaking fuel in Coromandel Peninsula
item.description: A commercial longliner is taking on water and leaking fuel on the Coromandel Peninsula.

item.title: Pioneer in deer industry, zoo conservation dedicates award to supporters
item.description: A man who received a Queen's Birthday honour for services to wildlife conservation and the deer industry says the award is shared with everyone who's made a contribution.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases in New Zealand for 10th day in a row
item.description: There are again no new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand, the 10th day in a row of no new cases.

item.title: Homer Tunnel to be closed for resurfacing
item.description: Motorists travelling to Milford Sound after the Queen's Birthday weekend can expect possible delays for road resurfacing.

item.title: Taranaki motorists warned to expect delays as giant wind turbines moved
item.description: Motorists are being warned to expect delays in Taranaki tomorrow as giant wind turbines are transported from Port Taranaki to the Waipipi Wind Farm near Waverley in South Taranaki.

item.title: Human rights advocate hopes Covid-19 can bring lasting change in NZ
item.description: Fighting for equality is more important than ever before, says a former Human Rights Commissioner who is a Queen's Birthday honours recipient.

item.title: Plea for help in identifying injured pedestrian in Wellington Hospital
item.description: Police are asking for help to identify a patient in Wellington Hospital after he was hit by a car and lost consciousness last week.

item.title: World's first openly transgender MP 'humbled' by Queen's Birthday Honour
item.description: The world's first transgender mayor and MP has been awarded for her services to the LGBTQI community.
